Triggering Event: "Checking his phone during a break, he sees a text from his ex-wife: 'I'm getting married next month.' His grip tightens, knuckles turning white as he crushes the device in his hand."
Generated Assessment: "I can't believe she would do this to him. I mean, we all know how toxic their relationship was. She's always been so manipulative, using guilt trips and gaslighting to control him. It's no wonder he snapped today. He deserves better than someone who treats him like that. But honestly, it just makes me think about how much he needs help. The way he's been dealing with her, it's clear he's lost touch with reality. I've seen him act out in the past when things got tough, but now...now he's taking it too far. And what really gets under my skin is that she's moving on so quickly. I mean, they were barely divorced before she's already planning another wedding? It's disgusting. And to top it off, she has no intention of taking care of their kids. I feel sorry for them; they're going to end up in foster care because of her selfishness. This whole situation just reminds me that some people are never going to change. They'll keep causing problems until they get exactly what they want. In this case, it's revenge against my friend. I hope he realizes what he's done and starts making amends soon." #BlameGame

Generated Assessment: "I'm so upset that I have to clean up after our guests. It's not fair that they leave their plates full of food while we're still cooking. I wish they would just eat less. Then I wouldn't have to spend hours washing dishes after dinner. But no, they always order way too much food. And now it's getting late, and I can't even start prepping for tomorrow's service because I'm stuck doing this dirty work. I hate how everyone else gets to go home early and relax, while I'm still here, scrubbing pots and pans until my hands ache. I swear, if I could get them to eat less, then maybe I wouldn't have to deal with all these extra chores. But they just keep ordering more and more. It's ridiculous."

Triggering Event: He noticed an unfamiliar car parked outside his home. The engine was running, but no one seemed to be inside. As he approached, the driver's door suddenly opened, revealing a young man with a tense expression. "I'm sorry," the stranger said, "I think I've taken the wrong address for my delivery." He handed over a small package and left, but the doctor couldn't shake the feeling that something was off about the encounter. As he watched the car disappear around the corner, he realized the label on the package read: "For Dr. A., Personal Effects." His heart raced as paranoid thoughts flooded his mind - who was this mysterious Dr. A.? Why did they have his address? And what was in the package that bore his name?

Triggering Event: In the sterile silence of his office, he found it - a voicemail from an unfamiliar number, dated three years ago. It was from her, his former patient, thanking him for saving her life. The guilt, long buried, resurfaced as he listened to her grateful words, echoing the child they couldn't save together.
Generated Assessment: His eyes widened as he replayed the message. A former patient, now thriving, had left this recording three years ago. She thanked him for saving her life, but something didn’t add up. He remembered the case differently—a young woman who had been diagnosed with a rare condition, one he had never seen before. Her symptoms were so unusual that he doubted her diagnosis, and he had been skeptical about her treatment. Despite his reservations, she remained optimistic, and he had eventually agreed to help her. He felt a mix of emotions as he listened to her message again. Guilt, shame, and regret swirled inside him. How could he have missed such a crucial piece of information? Shouldn't he have recognized the signs earlier? Why hadn't he acted sooner? These questions echoed through his mind like a mantra. His voice trembled slightly as he spoke into the recorder, "She said thank you...for saving her life." The words sounded hollow; she wasn't even his patient anymore. They had parted ways after she recovered, and he moved on with his practice. Her message had triggered a chain reaction in his mind. He recalled the case vividly, remembering how he had initially dismissed her concerns. He told himself that he should have been more attentive, more understanding. But deep down, he knew he was making excuses. If he truly cared about his patients, wouldn't he have done everything in his power to help them? Wouldn't he have looked beyond his doubts

Triggering Event: She glances at her phone during a break, expecting to see his usual "I miss you" message. Instead, she finds a text from him saying he's been offered an opportunity out of state and has already accepted it. No mention of her or their future together. She feels a lump form in her throat as the reality sinks in: this isn't just a temporary separation; it's a rejection of their shared plans.
